viable_candidates.name: World Inequality Database (WID.world)
viable_candidates.description: World Inequality Lab (Chancel, Piketty) publishes flagship World Inequality Report with granular data on global wealth, income, gender, and carbon inequality. WIR 2026 released Feb 2026.

evaluation.uniqueness: HIGH — not covered by existing WF1 sources (World Bank/IMF focus on macro policy, not distributional data)
evaluation.relevance_to_gaps: CRITICAL — directly addresses Economic and Social inequality gaps
evaluation.recommendation: PROMOTE — strong candidate for permanent source addition

viable_candidates.name: Council on Strategic Risks (AIxBio Program)
viable_candidates.description: Nonpartisan policy institute tracking AI-biology convergence risks, biosecurity governance, and synthetic biology ethics. Publishes annual AIxBio reviews with projections.

evaluation.uniqueness: HIGH — unique intersection of AI + biology + ethics governance, not covered by existing sources
evaluation.relevance_to_gaps: HIGH — addresses spiritual/ethics gap through bioethics and AI-bio convergence governance
evaluation.recommendation: VIABLE — good niche source for AI-bio ethics signals

viable_candidates.name: CaixaBank Research (Global Economics)
viable_candidates.description: European bank research division providing detailed global economic analysis, GDP forecasts, trade disruption scenarios, and structural shift analysis. Non-US perspective on global economy.

evaluation.uniqueness: MEDIUM — overlaps somewhat with IMF/World Bank, but provides independent European perspective with more granular trade/tariff analysis
evaluation.relevance_to_gaps: HIGH — directly addresses Economic gap with quantitative forecasts
evaluation.recommendation: VIABLE — useful complement to existing economic sources

viable_candidates.name: UVA Darden Ethics in AI Program
viable_candidates.description: University of Virginia Darden School tracks AI ethics implementation gap — the divide between ethical principles and actual practice. Focus on accountability, trust, and societal values.

evaluation.uniqueness: HIGH — focuses on the ethics-to-practice implementation gap, not just principles. Academic rigor from LaCross Institute.
evaluation.relevance_to_gaps: CRITICAL — directly addresses spiritual/values gap through AI ethics as defining societal issue
evaluation.recommendation: PROMOTE — strong candidate for permanent spiritual/ethics source

non_viable_candidates.name: NDE Beyond (AI Consciousness)
non_viable_candidates.description: Blog covering AI consciousness, near-death experiences, and philosophical questions about machine sentience.
non_viable_candidates.reason_non_viable: Low publication frequency and niche scope. Content is philosophically interesting but lacks the empirical rigor and policy relevance needed for environmental scanning signals. Better covered by academic sources like Darden.

gap_analysis_result.expected_post_merge_improvement: spiritual from 0% to ~6.7%, Economic from 8% to ~13.3%, Social stays at 16%+
